column4: @michael that command tests the performance for the HD. see the man entry for more.
﻿@michael__ what do you mean?
﻿@michael__ that is strange
﻿﻿@michael__ does that vary any from one test to another?
yes, a little. the 250 sata one. result in 56mb/s. the 80 pata old one, result in 57mb/s. a little quick??
i have a question about that. seemly, it cant give me a true result.
as i said.  i have two disk. one maxtor 80G pata, i buy it at 2004, other 250 sata, i buy it 2007.
i use the command to test both. but it showed me almost same result.
yes, it showed me both 57mb/s
but if i test both in windows. the 250 one. result in 58mb/s. the 80 pata, result in 17mb/s
ext3
yes
but the 250 disk, both in window and in linux, the test result same.
yes, agree that.
when i test the hard disk, just time a big file move. i get result 17mb/s.
linux
so maybe i think the hdparm dont give me a true result.

no i am not have a check, i am from china, and i cant suffer that website.
so now i have to buy another one. and i use my old 80g disk. and when i get the result in 57mb/s of it. why i buy another one? serious problem.
